name: Vic Schoen
aliases: The Vic Schoen Orchestra and Chorus

name: The Hurricanes

name: Larry Norman [US]
comments: Influential Christian rock singer/songwriter. Often considered the "father of Christian rock music".

name: Haitian Hate Gods

comments: House music duo of Koen Groeneveld and Addy van der Zwan.

Cates began playing tenor sax in various bands and later - for three decades - became the musical director of "The Lawrence Welk Show". He also made records with his own orchestra, mainly of film songs and themes.

Te Kanawa has received accolades in many countries singing a wide array of works in multiple languages from the 17th to the 20th centuries. She is particularly associated with the works of Mozart, Strauss, Verdi, Handel and Puccini

name: Mike Renzi
comments: Pianist, arranger, composer and musical director

name: William Tracey
comments: Lyricist born in New York City, who was a staff member for various publishing companies where he collaborated with composers such as Lewis Muir, George Meyer, Maceo Pinkard, Doris Tauber and Nat Vincent. He was also a charter member of the American Society of Composers, Authors and Publishers (ASCAP).

name: Maybelle Carter
comments: Influential country singer and guitarist. Briefly after marrying A.P. Carter's younger brother Ezra "Eck" in March 1926, she started singing and playing with the Carters, eventually leading into the legendary "Carter Family". Maybelle's mother and Sara's mother had been sisters, both Kilgores.

name: Ben Oakland
comments: Songwriter (generally as a composer) and pianist born in Brooklyn, New York. When he was 16 he left school to join a vaudeville act with Pinky Lee and Richard Himber. He then wrote and played for Helen Morgan. He also wrote songs for the Ziegfeld Follies, the Cotton Club Parade and other shows. He also composed songs and scores for motion pictures and television shows.

name: The Modernaires
comments: Harmonic vocal group that worked with a number of major dance bands before joining Glenn Miller & His Orchestra in 1941 and gaining notoriety there. The Modernaires continued on as an independent group after Miller's death in 1944.

name: Stranger Cole
comments: Singer, whose long recording career dates from the early days of ska in 1962.

name: Ken Lazarus
comments: Reggae vocalist; lead singer for Byron Lee and The Dragonaires.

name: Henry King
aliases: Henry King and His Hotel Pierre Orchestra
Henry King and His Pierre Hotel Orchestra
comments: Pianist. His orchestra evolved from a society band to one specializing in South American-style music by the late 1930s.

name: Sylvia McNair
comments: Opera soprano. By the 1990s she had changed her interests to Broadway and jazz standards.

name: Dee Dee Phelps
comments: Singer and songwriter from Santa Monica, California

name: Little Joe Blue

name: Blaggers I.T.A.

name: Gene Forrest

name: Eunice Levy
comments: Rhythm and Blues singer and songwriter.

comments: Dubbed many vocals in Hollywood movies.

name: Brennen Leigh
comments: Singer-songwriter and multi-instrumentalist from Austin, Texas.

name: Cowboy Buddha
comments: Country-rock band from the Orange County area. Active from 1995.

name: Ernest Thompson
comments: Bluegrass/country musician born in Clemmons, North Carolina. Blinded in a sawmill accident when he was 18, Thompson learned to play 26 different instruments.  He performed as a street musicians and at dances, with a recording career that lasted just five years.

name: Rentokill

name: Vena Cava

name: Mitchell Ayres

comments: Orchestra leader, composer, arranger and violinist.  Ayers is best known for his association with Perry Como on radio, television and records.  He was struck and killed by a car while he was crossing a street in Las Vegas.  Some sources give his year of birth as 1909.

name: David Carroll [US1]

comments: David Carroll was born Rodell Walter Schreier in Taylorville, Illinois. He was a conductor and arranger and the musical director for the Mercury label for about a decade beginning in 1951.

name: Dessau

name: Pentagram [US]

name: Goebel Reeves

name: Wendell Hall
comments: Country singer, multi-instrumentalist. Known as "The Red-Headed Music Maker".

name: Weary Willie
comments: Country music singer, dance band vocalist, playwright, songwriter and pianist

name: Terminal 46
comments: Industrial band based in Austin, Texas.

name: Claude Thornhill
aliases: Claude Thornhill and His Orchestra - Vocal Refrain by The Snowflakes

name: Barbara Brussell
comments: Cabaret singer with a number of appearances in musical revues

name: Dorsetshire

name: Cycloon
comments: Darkwave-fusion project begun by Axel Kleintjes that later became a band. Dissolved in 2005.

name: B-Movie
comments: New Wave band originating from Mansfield.

name: Tim Mitchell

name: mrDEYO

name: Ish Ledesma
comments: Guitarist and singer-songwriter, primarily on disco recordings

name: P.F. Sloan
comments: Musician (guitar, harmonica), singer, songwriter and producer

name: Tony Clarke
comments: Soul singer-songwriter, born in New York City and raised in Detroit, Michigan

name: Rick Rubin
comments: Record producer, born in Long Beach, New York

name: Glenn Frey
comments: Multi-instrumentalist, singer and songwriter in the rock and country-rock genres. He was inducted into the Songwriters Hall of Fame in 2000.  Frey also did some acting.

name: Bill Curtis
comments: Drummer from Fayetteville, North Carolina. Founder of Fatback Enterprises & Records.

name: Jim Messina
comments: Country rock/soft rock guitarist, singer and songwriter, plus record producer and engineer

name: Chip Taylor
comments: Singer, songwriter, performer, producer and record label owner. He is the brother of actor Jon Voight and the uncle of actress Angelina Jolie.   Taylor was inducted into the Songwriters Hall of Fame in 2016.

name: KRS One
comments: Rapper and producer from New York. Married to Ms. Melodie (Ramona Parker) from 1988 to 1992.

name: Ron Lenhoff
comments: Recording engineer and sound technican from Elsmere, Kentucky. He owned the Fidelity Recording Studio in Cincinnati, Ohio for eight years, than joined King Records . There he became famous for creating what is known as the "Cincinnati Sound".  After leaving the music business he worked as an elevator mechanic, traveled the world and worked for several nonprofit-organizations as chairman and secretary. He has died from stomach cancer.

name: Bob Geldof
comments: Singer, songwriter, political activist and KBE

name: Eric Stewart
comments: Multi-instrumentalist, singer-songwriter, record producer and filmscore composer from Droylsden, Lancashire

name: Hans Wärmling
comments: Musician and songwriter from Gothenburg. He was a singer and as well able to play multiple instruments among them guitar, trumpet and harp.

name: Martin Gore
comments: Skilled songwriter, singer and instrumentalist with a broad musical knowledge (as also proved by his solo recordings)

name: Walter Murphy
aliases: Walter Murphy & The Big Apple Band
comments: Composer, arranger, pianist, musician, and songwriter

name: Steve Miller
comments: Guitarist and singer-songwriter who is inducted into the Songwriters Hall of Fame in 2022

name: Garry Shider
comments: R&B and funk guitarist and singer from Plainfield, New Jersey, He was inducted into the ''Rock and Roll Hall of Fame'' in 1997. He died from lung cancer,

name: Joe South
comments: Singer-songwriter and guitarist, best known for his songwriting, won the Grammy for "Song of the Year" in 1970 for "Games People Play" and was again nominated for the award in 1972 for "Rose Garden".

name: Marshall Brickman
comments: Brazil-born banjo player, screenwriter and director.

name: Michael Viner
comments: Music producer and book publisher. In the 1970s Viner ran the short-lived MGM record subsidiary Pride, where he successfully formed The Incredible Bongo Band .

name: Bunny Botkin
comments: Composer, producer, arranger, and musician. Botkin has composed music to many 1970s and 1980's movies, often working with his partner Barry De Vorzon.

name: Felix Pappalardi
comments: Rock producer, bassist, vocalist and songwriter.

name: David Rea
comments: Folk singer, singer and guitarist from Ohio.

name: Donovan
comments: Scottish singer-songwriter and guitarist who is inducted into the Songwriters Hall of Fame in 2014

name: Dick Wagner
comments: Rock guitarist and songwriter, best known for his work with Alice Cooper, Lou Reed, Peter Gabriel and others.

name: Melvin Endsley
comments: Best known as a songwriter, Endsley was also a country music singer and musician.

name: Bobby Robinson
comments: Songwriter, producer, record company executive and owner of a record store in Harlem.  Robinson was a founder or co-founder of various record labels.

name: Syke Dyke
comments: Keyboardist, guitarist, engineer (i.e. Mad Hatter Studios, Los Angeles), producer,

name: James Avery
comments: Keyboardist, songwriter and producer for Trouble Funk

name: Derriere le Miroir
comments: Goth/synthpop band, their music self-described as "sensitive wave-pop"

name: The Charms [US1]
comments: Doo-wop vocal group from Cincinnati, active in the 1950s and early 1960s

name: EnCounter
comments: Synth pop trio - Leif Genberg, Hanna Jonsson & Patrik Eriksson

name: Sunnie O'Dea
comments: Dancer, actress and singer in several movies and Broadway shows in the 1930s and 1940s.

name: OnGuard
comments: Short-lived acoustic project of Jason Shevchuk

name: Russ Rankin
comments: Punk vocalist from Santa Cruz, California.

name: Tease
comments: R&B and funk group formed in California

name: Jack Cardwell
comments: Country music singer and songwriter from Alabama; later Caldwell became a local radio and television host in Mobile

name: Roy Alton
aliases: Roy Alton and The Puzzle People

name: Willy Rex
comments: Artist, composer and lyricist from Amsterdam

name: The Third Bardo
comments: Psychedelic and garage rock band from New York City.

name: Rusty Evans
comments: Singer, guitarist and songwriter, evolving from rockabilly to folk to psychedelia and all the way back again.

name: Schulz
comments: Collaboration of guitarist Günter Schulz and singer Jeff Borden

name: The Brian Jonestown Massacre
comments: Neo-psychedelic band formed in San Francisco in 1988.

name: Anton Newcombe
comments: Singer, songwriter and multi-instrumentalist in psychedelic rock, folk-rock, and experimental music.

name: Norfolk & Western
comments: Folk rock band formed in Portland, OR.

name: Bob Davis [US1]
comments: R&B songwriter, record producer, label owner and executive

name: Lou Sprung
comments: Songwriter, producer, record label executive, and record label owner

name: The Holsteins
comments: Five-piece group from Belfast, Northern Ireland.

name: Chris Stamey
comments: Guitarist, bass guitarist, singer, and songwriter in power pop and rock styles.

name: Paula West
comments: Jazz/cabaret singer based in Oakland, California

name: James Davis
aliases: James "Thunderbird" Davis and The Black Top All-Stars

name: Carole Carr
comments: Singer, who started her career as a dance-band singer at 14 and actress. She was the first singer to appear on British television when it resumed after the Second World War and also the first to appear on colour television test broadcasts in Britain in 1957.

name: Ken Page
comments: Cabaret singer and actor from St. Louis, Missouri

name: Andy Griffith
comments: Best known for starring in the US TV shows "The Andy Griffith Show" and "Matlock".

name: DeVotchKa
comments: Indie rock band from Denver, Colorado

name: Flyleaf
comments: Christian rock band from Belton, TX

name: Yoshida Brothers
comments: Two brothers, Ryōichirō and Kenichi Yoshida, performing since 1999 in the traditional Japanese music style of Tsugaru-jamisen.

name: Redd Evans
aliases: Redd Evans and His Billy Boys
comments: Composer, author, publisher, musician, singer and record executive from Meridian, Mississippi

name: Stone 588
comments: Darkwave band based in Fullerton, California.

name: The Dooley Sisters
comments: Duet from the Los Angeles area. They were seniors at UCLA when they first attracted attention with their recording of "Ko Ko Mo." They performed on local TV, Civic auditoriums and dances while still at UCLA.

name: Joe Derise
aliases: Joe Derise with the Australian Jazz Quartet

name: Eddy Giles
comments: Southern soul singer, guitarist and gospel radio executive.

name: Henry Lee Summer
aliases: Henry Lee Summer & The Alligator Brothers Band
comments: Rock musician, singer and songwriter, active since 1982

name: Cosmic Rough Riders
comments: Pop/rock band from Glasgow, United Kingdom. Formed in 1998.

name: Gatemouth Moore
aliases: Rev. Gatemouth Moore and His Gospel Singers
comments: Blues singer and gospel singer, songwriter, radio disc jockey, community leader and pastor

name: Dwid Hellion
comments: Singer, songwriter and founder of hardcore punk band Integrity.

name: Mandy Lee [US1]
comments: Pseudonym of a female vocalist, that has been used by three different singers, a.o. Bessie Brown and Vaughn De Leath .

name: Lena Wilson
comments: Wilson started her show business career in 1918 on the vaudeville circuit.  By the early-1920s, she was popular on the African American theater scene in New York City.  Wilson also cut a few blues records.

name: Georgia White
comments: Classic jazz and blues singer and pianist, most prolific in the 1930s and early 1940s.  Originally from Georgia, she spent much of her professional career in Chicago.

name: Krisiun
comments: Death metal band Ijuí, Rio Grande do Sul

name: Christopher Hampton
comments: Playwright, screen writer and film director

name: Thøger Olesen
comments: Songwriter specialized in translating foreign language song lyrics to Danish.

name: Jimmy Shirl
comments: Songwriter, who often collaborated with Ervin Drake

name: Otto Brandenburg
aliases: Ole Brandenburg mit Chor und Orchester

name: Poul Martin Bonde
comments: Musician, producer, manager, songwriter and label owner; also involved in the annual Skanderborg festival Smukfest

name: Steffen Brandt
comments: Singer, songwriter, guitarist and keyboard player.

name: F.K.A. Oedipusaurus Rex
comments: Short lived band from Pasadena, California

name: Bamse [DK]
comments: Singer, songwriter, lyricist and bass player

name: After Hours
comments: Hard rock group formed in Southampton

name: The Carpettes
comments: A punk rock band from Houghton-le-Spring, Tyne and Wear, England, formed in 1977.

name: Barleycorn
comments: Folk music band from Belfast that performed the range from traditional Irish music to rebel music ballads

name: Renaissance
comments: Progressive rock band combining female lead vocals with a fusion of classical music, folk, rock, and jazz.

name: Rick Chertoff
comments: Producer, record label executive and songwriter

name: Lee Sullivan
comments: Singer and actor on Broadway and in films, who also had his own television and radio shows

name: Sally Ann Howes
comments: Singer-actress with a long career in Broadway and West End musicals. She is probably best remembered for her role as "Truly Scrumptious" in the movie musical "Chitty Chitty Bang Bang" (1968).

name: Thomas Allen
comments: An operatic baritone from County Durham

name: Steen Springborg
comments: Actor, director, theatre manager and singer

name: Assolo
comments: Born in Roma. Lyricist, managing director, scouting, executive production and artist manager at Dueffel Music Married to Barbara Gimmelli, whose twin sister Daniela is married to Mogol .

name: Kansas City Red
comments: Blues drummer and vocalist who played a major role in the development of urban blues.

name: Joe Carter [US1]
aliases: Joe Carter and His Chicago Broomdusters

name: Eleanor Broadwater
comments: Wife of notable Nashville disc jockey Gene Nobles

name: Bumble Bee Slim
comments: Prolific blues singer and songwriter whose relaxed, upbeat style and often humorous lyrics made him one of the most-recorded and best-selling blues artists of the 1930s. His work exemplifies the beginnings of what came to be known as the Chicago style.

name: Blue Murder [GB1]
comments: Rock band, formed by John Sykes following his dismissal from Whitesnake

name: Demon [GB]
comments: Heavy metal band from Leek in Staffordshire

name: Lars H.U.G.
aliases: Lars Christmas H.U.G. and The Belltrees

name: Robert Coote
comments: Character actor best known for his roles as "Colonel Pickering" in the original stage production and 1976 stage revival of "My Fair Lady" and "King Pellinore" in the Broadway version of "Camelot".

name: Stanley Holloway
comments: English stage and film actor, comedian, singer, poet and monologist. He was famous for his comic and character roles on stage and screen, especially that of Alfred P. Doolittle in "My Fair Lady".

name: Thomas Blachman
aliases: Thomas Blachman and The X-Traditional Values
comments: Jazz and urban styles musician (mainly drummer), composer and producer. In 1995, Blue Note offered him a five album contract, which he turned down upon the label's refusing to include his Jazz/HipHop crossover production "Four Corners of Cool". Also an infamous judge in the jury of the Danish "X Factor" edition.

name: Al Agami
comments: Rap singer. Born in Uganda, the son of King John Bart Agami, but lives as a refugee in Denmark.

name: Monday Off
comments: Harmonic vocal group formed in Denver, Colorado when all four members were appearing in a production of the musical Titanic: Amy Cervini, Hilary Gardner, Richard Roland and Raymond Sage.

name: The Sandmen [DK]
comments: Rock band from Copenhagen. Years active: 1985-1995 and 2003-present

name: Ambra Angiolini
comments: Actress and television presenter. She debuted, while still a teenager, in the Italian TV show "Non è la Rai", and had a brief but successful career as a singer.

name: Mandisa
comments: Gospel/contemporary Christian singer who competed on season 5 of American Idol, finishing ninth

name: Daniel Massey
comments: Actor in both musical and non-musical roles on stage and screen

name: Ladri di biciclette
comments: Rhythm and blues band from Carpi.

name: Nick the Nightfly
aliases: Nick the Nightfly & The Monte Carlo Nights Orchestra

name: Sam Amidon
comments: Folk singer, fiddler, banjoist, and guitarist.  Amidon plays and reworks many traditional folk songs.

name: Kevin McKidd
comments: Scottish television and film actor, director and occasional singer born in Elgin, Moray, Scotland, UK, who is best known for playing the role of Owen Hunt in the medical drama television series "Grey's Anatomy".

name: Rob Lamothe
comments: Rock musician from California, residing in Canada since the mid-1990s.

name: McCluskey Brothers
comments: Folk pop duo from Glasgow/Scotland, formed by brothers Ken McCluskey (vocals, harmonica) and David McCluskey (drums, guitar, vocals) after their departure from pop group The Bluebells. With David McCluskey moving into music therapy, Ken McCluskey became a lecturer at Stow College.

name: Nelson Riddle
comments: Conductor and arranger, well known for his work with Capitol recording artists in the 1950s and 1960s

name: Miller Anderson
comments: Guitarist and vocalist born in Houston, Renfrewshire, Scotland.

name: Stevie Agnew
comments: Scottish singer and songwriter, based in and around historic Dunfermline, in Fife.

name: Mike Harrison
comments: Musician and singer from  Carlisle, Cumberland/England

name: Merrilee Rush
comments: Pop vocalist from near Seattle, Washington

name: CJSS
comments: Band from Cincinnati whose name stands for "Chastain, Jinkens, Sharp, & Skimmerhorn"

name: Craaft
comments: Hard rock band, founded in 1983 in Frankfurt.

name: Kelly Richey
comments: Blues rock guitarist, singer and composer based in Cincinnati

name: The Church Street Five
comments: The house band for Legrand Records, and various other labels owned by Frank Guida . The band also worked and recorded under some other names for Guida, such as "Baby" Earl & The Trini-Dads, King Coney & The Hot Dogs, and The South Street Six. The core of The Church Street Five included: - Daddy “G” - Gene Barge on sax, - Leonard Barks on trombone, and - Emmett "Nabs" Shields on drums. Norfolk, Virginia’s, Church Street, was once known as “The Harlem of the South”.

name: Koen van Dijk
comments: Writer, translator, lyricist and director. He translated a.o. Stephen Sondheim into Dutch: "West Side Story", "Sweeney Todd", "Into the Woods", "Company" and "Sunday in the Park with George".

name: Acoustic Hippies From Hell
comments: Formed by members of Def Leppard and Hothouse Flowers

name: Sam Taylor-Wood
comments: Conceptual artist, nominated for the Turner Prize in 1997, film director and actress.  She married actor Aaron Johnson in 2012 and now works under the name Sam Taylor-Johnson.

name: The Wrights [AU]
comments: A Once-off band formed by Nic Cester All profits of releases were donated to The Salvation Army for their work with drug and alcohol rehabilitation.

name: Chester Conn
comments: Composer of popular music and music publisher

name: Joe Sherman [US1]
aliases: Joe Sherman and The Arena Brass
Joe Sherman, His Orchestra and Chorus
comments: Composer, lyricist, conductor, arranger, publisher and producer

name: Noel Sherman
comments: Songwriter born in Brooklyn, New York City

name: Sue Palmer
aliases: Sue Palmer and Her Motel Swing Orchestra

name: Joel Siegel
comments: Georgetown University English professor who also was a lyricist, music producer (primarily in the field of jazz), artist manager (he managed jazz singer-songwriter Shirley Horn in the 1980s and 1990s) and freelance film and music critic.

name: César Vedani
comments: Poet and lyricist from Buenos Aires.

name: Carlos Gardel
aliases: Carlos Gardel con acomp. de guitarras
Carlos Gardel con acomp. de orquesta
Carlos Gardel con acomp. de sus guitarras
comments: French-born vocalist who brought tango music great popularity throughout Argentina and the world.

name: Lauren Agnelli
comments: Singer-songwriter, guitarist and bassist. An early New Waver with the band Nervus Rex, she then formed The Washington Squares in 1983. She was half of the duo Agnelli & Rave in the 1990s.

name: Jim Ferguson
comments: Acoustic bassist player and vocalist who is principally a jazz artist. He has performed and recorded as a sideman and a leader.

name: The Kit Kats
comments: Philadelphia area rock and roll band.

name: Paul Winley
comments: Songwriter and owner of the Winley Records and the Paul Winley Records labels. Brother of The Clovers' bass voice Harold Winley.

name: Vincent Scotto
comments: Composer, who during his lifetime wrote more than 4000 songs, some 60 operettas and about 50 film scores.

name: Henri Varna
comments: Comedian and lyricist, who has written under various aliases like Henri Varna, Henri Vantard or Varnel.

name: Roberto Conrado
comments: Songwriter, arranger, musician and record producer. Conrado moved his first steps in the music business playing drums in the beat band Gli Apostoli.

name: Van Broussard
aliases: Van Broussard and The Bayou Boogie Band
comments: Swamp pop musician from Prairieville, Louisiana

name: Max-Him
comments: Italo-disco studio project produced by Cruisin' Records. The artist name derives from the name of the first singer: Massimo Vaccari.

name: Deborah Coleman
comments: Blues singer and guitar player from Portsmouth, Virginia.

name: Carl Viggo Meincke
comments: Writer, composer, actor and theatre manager

name: Eddie Setser
comments: Country music songwriter born in Corbin, Kentucky

name: Shakin' Stevens and The Sunsets
comments: Rock 'n' roll band, most famous for backing Shakin' Stevens in his early days

name: E-Rotic
comments: Eurodance duo act formed by German record producer David Brandes, which originally consisted of German born singer Lyane Leigh (real name Liane Hegemann) and American rapper Richard Allen Smith (a.k.a. Raz-Ma-Taz).

name: Bengt Thomas
comments: Lyricist, who co-founded Polar Music, the Swedish record company, with his friend Stig Anderson

name: The Hep Stars
comments: Formed in Stockholm as a cover band, they soon, also due to their energetic live shows and in spite of their ugly sleeves, became Swedens most successful mid-1960s act performing in English. From 1966 on, they increasingly recorded self-written songs, later also in Swedish. Outside the Nordic countries the band is best known as a launching point for the keyboard player and composer Benny Andersson (of ABBA fame).

name: Garlands [US2]
comments: Indie rock band from Brooklyn, New York, comprising Chuck Blake, Matt Blake, Brett Whitmoyer and Raffi Yegparian

name: Kurt Winter
comments: Pop-rock guitarist and songwriter.  Winter left the Guess Who in 1974 and operated a bedding store in Toronto until his death from cancer.

name: The Zarths
comments: Indie-Punk band from Bochum, Nordrhein-Westfalen. Members: Rainer Bremer, Axel Stahlhut-Klipp, Frank Peternelly, Wulf Schneider

name: Bored
comments: Formed as a punk rock band in Geelong in 1987

name: Clowns Smiling Backwards
comments: Alternative pop-rock band from Melbourne, active during the late 1980s and into the 1990s

name: Sydney Youngblood
comments: Pop singer, who moved from the USA to Germany where he recorded his records

name: Bobby Graham
comments: Drummer, composer, arranger and producer.  As a prolific session musician, he was quite possibly the most recorded British drummer with an estimated 15,000 titles in his discography, although much of his work went unaccredited.

name: The Fingers
comments: Psychedelic band hailing from Southend-on-Sea, active in the 1960s

name: Conny van Bergen
comments: Singer from Hilversum, active since the early 1960s

name: Margi Clarke
comments: Actress, star of the film "Letter to Brezhnev".

name: Jamie Reid
comments: Artist, responsible for the sleeves of many releases by Sex Pistols , including Anarchy in the U.K. , Holidays in the Sun and Never Mind the Bollocks, Here's the Sex Pistols .

name: Myron McCormick
comments: Character actor with many appearances on stage, screen and television.

name: Don Gordon
comments: Industrial artist originally based in Vancouver.

name: Joe Pesci
comments: Actor, who began his show-business career as a musician, initially as a guitarist in 'Joey Dee & The Starliters' and later on as a solo singer.

name: Richard Burton
comments: A Welsh actor who was noted for his mellifluous baritone voice. Burton established himself as a formidable Shakespearean actor in the 1950s, and he gave a memorable performance of Hamlet in 1964.

name: Emilie Autumn
comments: Goth-industrial vocalist,  singer-songwriter, poet and violinist from Los Angeles, California

name: Katie Noonan
comments: Singer-songwriter who has performed rock, pop, dance music, jazz and opera.  Noonan also plays keyboards.

name: Johnny Pate
comments: Jazz bassist and composer, who became an important arranger and producer in Chicago soul

name: Mattsson
comments: Metal/hard rock band led by Lars Eric Mattsson. Formed in 1992.

name: Dogpound
comments: Melodic hard rock band. Formed in 1999.

name: Daniel Flores
comments: Chilean-born prog rock/metal drummer and keyboardist

name: Eric Sands
comments: Guitarist and bassist from Woodstock, Georgia.

name: House of Shakira
comments: Hard rock band formed in Stockholm
